commitResults.messageTitle: Week 2 task
Add storage class to save/load tasks data
Update main to store/load data automatically
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Deadline/Event: Parse and format date-time
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadlines and events stored date/time as strings.

Store date/time as LocalDateTime so input can be validated and output
can be formatted consistently.

Created DateTimeUtil class to handle date and time input by user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix date-time parsing and display errors
commitResults.messageBody:
Date/time parsing code contains compilation errors and inconsistent
variable usage.

These errors prevent deadline and event commands from working correctly.

Fix malformed conditional checks, validate the correct input variables,
and format deadline output using the display formatter.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-level-8'
Ui: Extract input reading and divider output
commitResults.messageBody: Extract a Ui class to handle reading commands and printing the divider line so the main class can focus on coordinating app logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList: Wrap tasks in a TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a TaskList class to own the task collection and provide basic
operations (add/remove/get/size/isEmpty), and update app methods to use
TaskList instead of ArrayList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Storage to handle task persistence
commitResults.messageBody:
- Introduce instance-based Storage with configurable file path
- Add load() to read tasks from disk and parse into Task objects
- Add save(TaskList) to serialize tasks and write to disk
- Ensure data directory/file are created before read/write

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser: Parse command arguments for all user commands
refactor: organize classes into packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Moved classes from the default package to the `sillyrat` package namespace.
Created sub-packages for better separation of concerns:
- sillyrat.task
- sillyrat.command/parser
- sillyrat.storage
- sillyrat.ui

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/add-gradle-support'
Configure project to use Gradle for build automation
commitResults.messageBody:
- Merged the 'add-gradle-support' branch to enable Gradle build tools.
- Updated project structure to support automated testing and JAR creation via Gradle.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit coverage for parser and task loading
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add ParserTest to verify command parsing and validation errors
- Add LoadTaskTest to cover Task.toLoadTask for todo/deadline/event and unknown types
- Align date-time assertions with storage formatting (includes seconds)

commitResults.messageTitle: Configure executable fat JAR packaging via shadowJar
commitResults.messageBody:
- Set jar base name and classifier for a single runnable artifact
- Add Main-Class manifest entry for java -jar execution
- Make build depend on shadowJar to produce the distributable JAR by default

commitResults.messageTitle: Add header commments for common and parser
Add Javadoc headers for Storage class
Add Javadoc header for task classes
Add Javadoc header for Ui class
Add Javadoc header to main program SillyRat class
Fix formatting and indentation for all classes to follow given coding style
Add find feature to search tasks by keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement find command to allow users to search for tasks by
keywords in task descriptions. The command displays matching tasks
with their original numbering.

- Add FindArgs class to encapsulate search parameters
- Add find() method in TaskList to filter tasks by keyword
- Update Parser to handle "find" command and include it in error messages
- Add doFind() method in SillyRat to display search results
- Handle empty search results with appropriate user feedback

Example usage: find book

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch A-CodingStyles and resolved conflict in SillyRat class
Merge branch 'branch-Level-9'
commitResults.messageBody: - resolve conflicts for SillyRat class and Parser

commitResults.messageTitle: Add import for FindArgs class
SillyRat class: Fix style violations
Style: Add Javadoc and fix spacing
commitResults.messageBody:
The source code lacks Javadoc comments and proper vertical spacing.

This reduces code readability and violates the coding standards.

Add Javadoc headers to all classes and methods.
Insert empty lines between methods to improve readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update build.gradle to set up Java FX
Add curly braces to fix error in build.gradle
UI: Add GUI layout and image resources
commitResults.messageBody:
The application currently relies solely on a text-based Command Line
Interface (CLI) for user interaction.

A graphical user interface (GUI) provides a more intuitive and visually
appealing experience for the user.

Add FXML files for the MainWindow and DialogBox layouts.
Create the Main application class to initialize the JavaFX GUI.
Add image files to be used as avatars or UI assets.

Using FXML separates the view layout from the application logic, making
the UI components easier to manage and update in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: Add GUI layout and image resources
commitResults.messageBody:
The application currently relies solely on a text-based Command Line
Interface (CLI) for user interaction.

A graphical user interface (GUI) provides a more intuitive and visually
appealing experience for the user.

Add FXML files for the MainWindow and DialogBox layouts.
Create the Main application class to initialize the JavaFX GUI.
Add image files to be used as avatars or UI assets.

Using FXML separates the view layout from the application logic, making
the UI components easier to manage and update in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: SillyRat class: Return string responses for GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
The SillyRat class currently processes commands and prints the output
directly to the standard console.

To support the new graphical user interface, the application logic must
pass text back to the UI rather than printing it directly.

Update the command execution methods in the SillyRat class to return
string responses.

Returning strings allows the UI components to handle all rendering,
keeping the core logic and presentation layers cleanly separated.

commitResults.messageTitle: Launcher: Add class to initialize application
UI: Add FXML files for MainWindow and DialogBox
commitResults.messageBody:
The application UI layout is currently undefined or hardcoded within
the Java classes.

Hardcoding UI elements makes the presentation layer difficult to
modify and maintain.

Add FXML files for the MainWindow and DialogBox components.

Using FXML allows the layout to be opened and edited visually using
Scene Builder, making future UI adjustments much easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Build: Fix Launcher path and FXML loader typo
commitResults.messageBody:
The build.gradle file points to the wrong main class, and a syntax
error in the FXML loader prevents the GUI controller from linking.

These minor errors cause the build process to fail and crash the
application upon startup.

Change the main class reference in build.gradle to the Launcher class.
Correct the typo in the fxmlLoader.getController() call to properly
inject the SillyRat instance into the MainWindow.

Fixing these configuration and syntax errors ensures the application
compiles and runs the JavaFX GUI correctly.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: Fix JavaFX version and implement app exit
commitResults.messageBody:
The DialogBox specifies an incorrect JavaFX version, and the bye
command only returns a farewell string without closing the app.

The wrong version can cause FXML loading errors. Furthermore, users
expect the application to completely terminate when issuing a bye
command.

Correct the JavaFX version attribute in the DialogBox FXML file.
Add Platform.exit() to the bye command logic.

Using Platform.exit() ensures the JavaFX application thread shuts
down gracefully instead of hanging in the background.

commitResults.messageTitle: Core: Add assert statements to logic classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The core logic classes currently lack runtime verification for internal
assumptions and invariants.

Unverified assumptions can lead to silent failures or unpredictable
behavior if invalid data is passed between components like the Parser
and TaskList.

Add assert statements to Parser, TaskList, Task, SillyRat, Event,
Deadline, and Storage to validate method arguments and states.

Assertions help catch bugs early during development by failing fast
when the application reaches an impossible state.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Improve code quality and readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Several classes contain code smells such as deep nesting, long methods,
duplicated code, and magic literals.

These issues reduce code readability, increase the risk of bugs, and
make future maintenance difficult.

Extract command parsing logic into a new SillyRatParser class.
Replace magic strings and numbers in Task subclasses with named
constants and a Command enum.
Apply guard clauses in SillyRat.replyMark() to reduce deep nesting.
Simplify boolean conditions in Storage and remove duplicated save
patterns in SillyRat.getResponse().
Fix empty fall-through cases in the Parser switch statement.

Addressing these code smells adheres to standard coding practices and
creates a cleaner, more maintainable architecture.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #2 from Zixuan224/branch-A-Assertions
commitResults.messageBody: Core: Add assert statements to logic classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' into branch-A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody:
Prioritise the better quality code from branch-A-CodeQuality
Edit the assert statements with respect to the new code

commitResults.messageTitle: SillyRat Class: Fix typo in function name
Merge pull request #3 from Zixuan224/branch-A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody: Refractor: Improve code quality and readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Show upcoming task reminders on startup
commitResults.messageBody:
The application currently waits for user input before displaying any
task information upon launch.

Users might forget about impending deadlines or events unless they
manually check their task list immediately after opening the app.

Add logic in the SillyRat class to fetch and format upcoming tasks.
Update MainWindow to automatically send and render this reminder
message when the GUI initializes.

Proactively showing reminders improves the user experience by
immediately highlighting urgent tasks without requiring manual prompts.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add reminder command for upcoming tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can currently only view upcoming task reminders automatically
when the application first launches.

Users might need to check their impending deadlines or events during
a session without having to restart the entire application.

Add a reminder command to the Command enum and Parser class.
Implement filtering logic in TaskList to retrieve upcoming tasks.
Update SillyRat to process the command and return the formatted list.

Providing a dedicated command gives users on-demand access to their
urgent tasks, improving the overall utility of the application.
